definition: to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: The escaped prisoner had less than two weeks left to serve.
sentences.chinese: 而逃跑女孩要“伏法”的时间只剩下不到二个星期。

sentences.english: Cheat of Xiao Han of final police officer gave guilty fact of Chen Yaoguang, make its be executed.
sentences.chinese: 最终警官萧汉诈出了陈耀光的犯罪事实，令其伏法。

sentences.english: Finally, under the intervention of emperor Shunzhi, the two robbers were decapitated in the end.
sentences.chinese: 在顺治帝的亲自过问下，终于使二贼伏法。

definition: to punish according to the law/to bring to justice
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
unfettered and beyond the law (idiom); evading retribution/getting away with it (e.g. crimes)/still at large
to exonerate/to clear (from an accusation)/to rehabilitate
on trial (for a crime)/to stand trial
public trial (in a court of law)
lit. strung through and filled with evil (idiom); filled with extreme evil/replete with vice/guilty of monstrous crimes
guilty and deserves to be punished (idiom); entirely appropriate chastisement/the punishment fits the crime
